title: Ancient Astronomy & Mathematics
description: Early astronomical observations and practical mathematics in Mesopotamia and Egypt enabled calendars, architecture, and trade—foundations for later scientific methods.

title: Greek Natural Philosophy
description: Thinkers like Thales, Pythagoras, and Aristotle established rational inquiry, geometry, and basic physical theories that shaped Western science for centuries.

title: Islamic Golden Age
description: Scholars in the Islamic world preserved and expanded Greek knowledge—advances in algebra, optics, medicine, and astronomy (Al-Khwarizmi, Ibn al-Haytham, Avicenna).

title: Copernican Revolution
description: Nicolaus Copernicus proposed a heliocentric model in 'De revolutionibus', challenging geocentric orthodoxy and paving the way for modern astronomy.

title: Galileo Galilei
description: Using improved telescopes, Galileo made key astronomical discoveries (moons of Jupiter, phases of Venus) and championed experimental observation.

title: Newtonian Synthesis
description: Isaac Newton's 'Principia' unified celestial and terrestrial mechanics with universal gravitation and laws of motion—cornerstone of classical physics.

title: Chemical Revolution
description: Antoine Lavoisier established modern chemistry by identifying elements, naming oxygen, and quantifying conservation of mass—ending phlogiston theory.

title: Evolution by Natural Selection
description: Charles Darwin's 'On the Origin of Species' proposed natural selection as the mechanism for evolution, transforming biology and life sciences.

title: Radioactivity & Radiochemistry
description: Marie and Pierre Curie's discovery and study of radioactivity opened new fields in physics, medicine, and atomic science.

title: Einstein's Annus Mirabilis
description: Albert Einstein published papers on the photoelectric effect, Brownian motion, and special relativity—revolutionizing physics and conceptions of space and time.

title: Discovery of DNA Structure
description: Watson and Crick described the double helix, launching molecular biology and transforming genetics and medicine.

title: Moon Landing
description: Apollo 11 landed humans on the Moon — a technological milestone demonstrating large-scale engineering, computing, and scientific collaboration.

title: CRISPR & Gene Editing
description: CRISPR-Cas systems enabled precise gene editing, accelerating research and raising ethical and societal questions about human genetic modification.
